When Michael Chanak Jr. joined P&G in the mid-1980s, a time when being gay was not openly discussed, especially in the workplace and the AIDS epidemic was rampant. In 1992, P&G became one of the first Fortune 500 companies to add sexual orientation to its equal employment opportunity (EEO) statement of diversity.
 
In 2018, we partnered with @greatbigstory to produce, "The Words Matter", a short film highlighting Chanak's perseverance and leadership to inspire to our company to change policy to protect the rights of gay people against discrimination at the workplace and ultimately improve the lives of LGBTQ+ workers across the country.
